Let's give you some ideas. Maybe you'll take them and run with them, or maybe they'll inspire you to create your own character:

Marina is a young girl, about to turn 14. She doesn't know it yet, but she's inherited more from her mother than just her good looks.

Caleb is taking his girlfriend, Ariel, to a little spot he's just discovered. He thinks a little dip in the pool he finds there won't hurt anything, but it will change everything about him. And I do mean everything.

Or maybe you'd like to see Ariel take that dip? Granted, she won't be changed as much, but it's still not the future she imagined for herself.

Or maybe someone else? Someone who you've created?

Whatever the case, bone up on what merfolk are like in this interactive, and let's go.
1.title: First Choices

11.content:
I'm Marina Douglas.

I was born and raised in Roderick Bay, a fishing village on the East Coast. My dad was Jonas Douglas, a commercial fisherman who helped keep the village fed. My stepmother was Cordelia, and Adrian was my half-brother. For my young life, Dad didn't say a lot about Mom; only that she left when I was a baby, and that he loved her and missed her every day. He had a few pictures of her, and she and I looked a lot alike. Hardly a day went by without Dad saying to me, "Princess, you look more like your mother every day."

Dad had his own boat, which he called Heart of Doria. He only took me out on her once a year, on my birthday. Adrian, on the other hand, got to go out anytime there wasn't school. "How come Adrian gets to go out all the time," I would ask, "and I don't?"

"When I retire," he'd reply, "Adrian will take over the boat. But you, Princess, have another destiny."

"What destiny is that, Daddy?"

"One day, you'll see your mother, and you'll know your destiny then."

Dad made it sound so amazing, I really wanted to believe him sometimes. But I had to wonder why he went to the trouble. I mean, sure, I was blonde and pretty, but I was still a fisherman's daughter. People like me didn't have grand destinies. We married local boys and started having kids before we graduated. And that was the happy future.

But, as it turned out, I was more than just a fisherman's daughter. And I did have a grand destiny.

And I learned about it in the days between my first period and my 14th birthday.
11.title: Marina's Tail

111.content:
A week before I turned 14, I was going to the bathroom when I saw it. The thing that so many girls look forward to, and I was no exception: A red stain on my panties.

If Dad and Adrian had been home, I would have asked Cordelia to come in, and told her privately. But they were out fishing, so I didn't need to be discreet: "Hey, Cordie, I'm on the rag!"

She came running. "Oh, Marina! I'm so happy for you! Thank you so much for asking for me, instead of calling your friends!"

I'm not kidding, that's what she said, and how she said it. I know she really wanted to bond with me, but she seemed to think that trying too hard wasn't trying hard enough.

She asked for the panties, and sprayed them with something. "This is supposed to prevent staining. Unfortunately, it almost never does. So, don't be surprised if these become your 'period panties.'"

She stepped out for a minute, and came back with a clean pair of my panties. She showed me how to put a pad into them. So she could be a great help, and I loved her. I just wish she dialed it back sometimes.

"How do you feel?" she asked.

"I'd like to lie down for a little bit."

So she helped me up, and supported me as I walked back to my bedroom, and helped me get into bed. I just lay there for a few minutes, with my hands over my lower belly, thinking to myself, I'm a woman. I'm really a woman.

When I was ready, I texted my best friends, Coral and Bermuda, and told them I'd gotten my period. They came right over, bringing Hershey bars. "Welcome to the club, girlfriend," Coral said, as she and Bermuda had been through it before me. "Though it's weird that you got the curse before you started shaving your legs."

"Leave her alone," Bermuda retorted. "It's bad enough that men talk like there's only one way for women to be. The last thing we should do is join them at it."

I was grateful for the support, but I knew what Coral was talking about: Of the three of us, I was the only one who hadn't yet needed to shave her legs, or her pits, either. All the hair I grew was on my head.

******************************


When Dad and Adrian came in, smelling of fish and salt water, Cordelia told them, "You boys have two women in the house to deal with, now. Marina's on the cycle."

"Congratulations, Princess," Dad said, and he hugged me. For some reason, the way he smelled comforted me, as much as his hug.

Adrian just said one word: "Gross."

******************************


Late that night, I got up to get a drink.

I poured a glass of water, and I took a swig. Then, I grabbed a canister of sea salt, and poured some into the glass, stirring it with my finger. Deciding that tasted better, I took the glass to bed.

It wasn't until I got to the bottom of the glass that I remembered: people aren't supposed to drink salt water.

So why did I like it so much?
111.title: My Period

1111.content:
The next morning, my thirst for salt water was undiminished. I didn't know why I needed it, but I definitely did.

"I could have sworn we had more sea salt than this," Cordelia said. "Where did it all go?"

I said nothing, knowing that the answer was in the water bottle I was drinking from.

"Well," Cordelia said, "there's nothing to do about it but run into town. You should be okay. I'm sure the worst of your period is over. Just watch the house until your father and Adrian get home." With that, she left.

Cordelia was right, the worst of my period was over. All I had to deal with on that end was changing out my pad every few hours. But there was something else to be concerned about.

In the living room sat Dad's aquarium. He fed them twice a day, and he loved to look at them. He always said that, no matter what was going on in the world, a half hour looking at the fish could put him right.

He also shared his love of fish with us, our friends, any relatives who came to visit, and any other houseguests. He knew everything about the fish in that tank. Even if you tuned him out when he started talking about fish, you'd come away knowing how important they were to him.

On that day, however, the aquarium wasn't stirring thoughts about the things Dad loved. Instead, whenever I looked at it, my tummy would fumble and my mouth would water. Why would I want to eat those fish? I thought. I decided to ignore this new craving.

Unfortunately, I didn't have enough willpower to accomplish that. Half an hour after I tried to ignore it, I walked right up to the tank. Selecting a clownfish, I pulled it out of the water, put it in my mouth, and ate it. It tasted good, like something a rich snoot would pay a few hundred bucks for at a restaurant.

Since that was so tasty, I decided to try an angelfish next. Just like before, I pulled it out of the water.

And, when Dad walked in, he had just enough time to realize what I was doing before I ate it.

He looked at me. I looked at him. And it finally dawned on me what I'd done.

Tears in my eyes, I ran to my room, and buried my face in my pillow. How could I have done such a horrible, horrible thing? And why did I want to do it again, and keep on doing it?

When Dad came in, I didn't dare look at him. "I'm sorry, Daddy," I said. "And yet, I'm not sorry at all. I think... I think I want to keep doing it. What's wrong with me?"

Dad put his hand on my shoulder. "Nothing's wrong with you, Princess," he said. "I'm not mad. I'm not even disappointed. If anything, it's a bittersweet feeling. I knew this day was coming. I just... I thought we'd have a little more time, is all."

I sat up, and turned to face him. "What is it, Daddy? What's happening to me?"

He put his arm around me. "You really are becoming more like your mother, Princess: You're becoming a mermaid."
1111.title: Appetite

11111.content:
"A... mermaid?" I couldn't believe my ears. "But, Daddy, there's no such thing as mermaids. Everybody knows that."

"But I know better, Princess," Dad replied. "I've met a few merfolk, and fell in love with one. You're living proof of that. When Cordelia gets back, we'll all talk about it. Have you started drinking salt water?"

"How did you - "

"Because you're Doria's daughter, and I've never forgotten my first love."

******************************


Cordelia got back a half hour later, and Dad sat us all down at the kitchen table. "I met her the way you would expect a mermaid and a fisherman to meet: she got caught in my net. I won't deny it, when I saw her, I thought of how much money she could bring in for me. Once I looked into those seafoam green eyes, though, all I wanted to do was protect her. When she kissed me, that sealed the deal." Dad stopped to chuckle. "She told me later that merfolk absorb languages through physical contact, so just touching my hand would have helped her. But, when she looked into my eyes, she felt she just had to kiss me."

"She wasn't the only one," Cordelia said.

"Once she could speak English," Dad continued, "she told me her name was Doria. Once she was dry, she got her legs, and she needed a place to stay. So I took her in, and put her up in my guest bedroom. The more we talked, the deeper we fell in love, and it wasn't long before she and I were sharing a bed. Almost before we knew it, she was pregnant." Dad looked at me and smiled. "The second time I fell in love at first sight. The three of us were happy together.

"Just after you'd been weaned, a couple of mermen showed up. Her father, the king of Poseidia, had died, and so they came to ask her out of exile, and take her rightful place on the throne." Again, he looked at me. "That's why I always call you Princess: Because it's what you are. Because you didn't have a tail or gills yet, she had to leave you behind, with me. But she told me you would one day have to join her, and it looks like that day is coming soon."

"What do we need to do?" Cordelia asked, clutching my hand.

"When you're ready, Marina, we'll take you out on the boat, and you'll swim to join your mother. In the meantime, I'll start bringing seawater back with me, so you can stop using all the salt. I've kept a few fish in the live box, just in case, and it looks like it's time. Those fish will tide you over better than the fish in my aquarium."

"Daddy, maybe you're mistaken. Maybe I'm not a mermaid. Maybe - "

"If any of us were to take a swig from your water bottle, we'd be sick as dogs, and you know it. It's happening, Princess, and it's not going to stop. Soon, it will be undeniable."

******************************


Dad was right, the fish he caught were more filling than the fish in the aquarium.

I went to bed that night with my head full of Dad's stories. I dreamed of the sea. In some of the dreams, I heard a woman's voice, calling to me.
11111.title: A Mermaid?

111111.content:
When I woke up the next morning, my feet were out from under the covers. As I stretched, I happened to be looking at them. That was how I saw it. You see, I spread my toes as I stretched, but some of my toes didn't spread. And those that did were now webbed.

I sat up and brought my feet closer to get a better look. The reason some of my toes wouldn't spread was because they were fused together.

As I examined my feet, something else caught my eye. Moving my sheets, I saw that patches of the skin on my shins were covered with blue-green scales. I touched them, and they felt like fish scales. "Hoo, boy."

I stood up and went to my mirror. I also had scales on my thighs, and a patch of scales in place of pubic hair. "Hoo, boy."

Two things were abundantly clear: I was definitely turning into a mermaid, and I had to tell my friends, Coral and Bermuda, all about it.

******************************


"You have got to be kidding," Bermuda said. "A mermaid? There's no such thing."

"I'm serious," I replied. "My mom is a mermaid, and I'm turning into one, too."

The three of us were sitting in my room, like we had been two days before, when we were celebrating my period. Now, though, I was dressed only in my bathrobe, and my feet were the center of attention.

"You've got a better explanation for her toes?" Coral asked. "Because I'd love to hear it."

"I don't know what's going on with her feet," Bermuda replied, "because I'm not a doctor. And you need a doctor, Marina, not fish stories from your father."

I stood up. "Under no circumstances am I letting any doctor, anywhere, look at this." I opened my robe and showed them my scales.

"Yep," Coral said, "I guess that settles it. So, what now?"

"Dad says, once I change completely, I'll go to be with my mom for a while."

"How long is that?"

"I don't know. She and I have a lot of catching up to do. And there may be rules that I couldn't even guess. But I promise, when I can come back, I'm going to come and see everyone."

"I'm going to hold you to that," Bermuda said.

"Same here," Coral said.

The three of us embraced.
111111.title: The Next Day

1111111.content:
As you can imagine, I stopped going outside after I started getting scales. I didn't want our neighbor, Mrs. Aberdeen, to know I was becoming a mermaid. Besides, merfolk aren't known for their tans, so I really didn't need to go out, until it was time for me to go see Mom.

I woke up the next morning to find that the scaly patches were bigger, and all my toes were now fused. Also, my fingers were webbed a bit. Not Creature from the Black Lagoon territory, but enough to help push me through the water when it was time for me to swim.

All that would have been headlines enough. But, when I walked into the bathroom, the mirror offered up another surprise for me. Six surprises, to be exact: three slits on either side of my neck. Slits that opened and closed with each breath I took.

Gills.

Cordelia tried to act normal, like the changes I was going through were just something in a chapter that somehow got edited out of What's Happening to My Body?. But she couldn't hide her reactions when I extended a hand in her direction, or when she saw my gills working. The only thing worse was when I ate: Live fish were delicious to me, but watching me eat did nothing for her appetite.

When Coral and Bermuda showed up, Cordelia was even happier to see them than I was. After all, they were unchanged, human. I was the only one preparing for the life aquatic.

"Your butt looks smaller in those shorts," Bermuda said.

"It's not the shorts," I replied. "My butt really is smaller. Who ever heard of a mermaid with a badonkadonk?"

"You sound okay with it," Coral said.

"I'm getting used to it. This morning, I posed for the mirror the way mermaids are drawn: combing my hair, and letting my legs dangle off the side of the bed." I demonstrated.

******************************


When Dad got home, I showed him the new changes.

He nodded. "Looks like you'll be going on your birthday, Princess," he said. "Do your gills work?"

"I don't know. I haven't tried them."

"No, you probably wouldn't have," he said. "You'll need something for that. And I've brought it in my truck."

He went out, and returned with a five-gallon bottle. As he poured it into my bathtub, I could smell the seawater. Then, he brought in another bottle, and another, and another. When he ran out of five-gallon bottles, he brought smaller ones, until the tub was full.

"A little privacy?" I asked.

When I was alone, I took off my clothes, climbed into the tub, and submerged.I was scared for a little while, but I soon realized that I could breathe just fine. The water felt wonderful going through my gills.

As I dried off and got dressed again, I knew it would be quite a while before I slept on a human bed again.

choices: My Birthday, and the Final Change
11111111.content:
There isn't much to say about the next two days, as all we did was plan my upcoming one-way trip. My family would carry me out to Dad's truck, then from the truck to the Heart of Doria. Then, Dad would pilot it out to sea, and I would get overboard and swim down. Other than that, all I did was watch my scales spread, and keep track of my diminishing butt.

The day before my birthday, I was covered in blue-green scales from the waist down. My toenails were gone, too, and the way my feet felt told me I had just one day of walking left.

I didn't think the day had any surprises for me, but it did. I left my room to get my lunch (one fish, still alive), when my family and friends yelled, "Surprise!"

In response to my puzzled look, Coral said, "We figured, since you'll be gone tomorrow, we'd have your birthday party today."

"Thanks, guys," I said, hugging them. "I appreciate this."

Naturally, the party was light on presents. After all, I wouldn't be needing blue jeans or cute shoes, would I? But Coral and Bermuda did make a clamshell bra for me, and I'd need that at least part of the day.

And, although I mostly ate nothing but fish, I had no idea when I would have cake and ice cream again, so that was a treat.

But I still had to eat my fish in my room, where nobody would see it bleed.

And it was such a relief when I got off my feet at the end of the day. Tomorrow, I knew, I wouldn't be walking anywhere.
11111111.title: Days Go By

111111111.content:
The next time I woke up, I sensed somehow that it was in the wee hours of the morning. My eyes could see quite well in the darkness. My feet were no longer feet. And the point where my legs separated was now just below where my knees had been.

I guessed now was as good a time as any. "Cordy!"

After a few minutes, she opened the bathroom door and turned on the light. "Did you say something, hon - Oh, dear Lord!"

"What's going on?" Adrian called out, his voice getting closer.

Cordelia intercepted him. "Go get your father," she said. "Tell him Marina needs help. I'll get her ready."

When Adrian went off, Cordelia said, "No need for him to see you like this. Now, let's get this clamshell bra on you."

As she tied the bra in place, she asked, "How do you feel, honey? Does it hurt?"

"No, it doesn't," I replied. "It just isn't something I'm used to."

Once Dad was in the bathroom, he and Cordelia carried me to the bed of his pickup truck. Then they threw a tarp over me, and the rest of the family got into the cab and drove me out to the dock.

When the tarp was taken off of me, we saw that my calves had fused together. It wouldn't be long now. I was hauled aboard the Heart of Doria, and we shoved off.

During the voyage out to sea, what had been my feet joined together, and my lower body grew into a tail. And I do mean grew: my tail was twice as long as my lower body had been with legs.

Finally, Dad turned the engines off, and came out with us. "This is about where we first met," he said. "Do you need any help?"

"Let me try, Daddy," I replied. "Help me to the rail."

I tried, but climbing is easier if you have legs. Dad and Cordelia ended up having to lift me up over the rail, and throwing me over the side.

Once I was in the water, I was literally in my element. I swam a few laps around the boat, getting the hang of swimming with a tail. When I felt ready, I surfaced, waved, blew kisses goodbye, and dove down.

I was about 200 feet down when I saw them: two mermen and a merwoman. As I swam down, they swam up.

As we got closer to each other, I could see more details. The mermen were armed, and the merwoman wore a gold crown and an ornate bra. Could it be... ?

Finally, we were face to face. She was older, but otherwise looked like... me.

"Marina?" she asked.

"M... Mom?"

She swam up and hugged me. I hugged her back, pretty sure my tears of joy were enough to raise the water level.
111111111.title: My Birthday, and the Final Change

1111111111.content:
When Mom stopped hugging me, she said, "Come, Marina. It is time for you to see your ancestral home, and your birthright."

She turned and began swimming down. I followed her, with the mermen flanking us. They seemed to be guards, as they discouraged sharks and other marine predators from getting too close to us.

I saw something strange ahead. It looked like a glowing eddy beneath the waves. "What's that?" I asked.

"That is our way home," she replied. "An underwater portal that will take us to Poseidia, in Atlantis."

We swam into the portal, and the currents within carried us with dizzying swiftness. I had no way of telling where we were anymore. Part of me suspected that the portal was in another dimension, which let us move so fast.

The portal let us out in a large chamber. Once we had collected ourselves, the mermen opened the door, and we swam out into a bustling city. The merfolk around us took notice of us, and crossed their arms against their chests, which I took to be a gesture of respect. Seeing Mom give a little wave, I did the same, and we swam to what looked like a palace that was partially encased in coral.

Entering the palace, I saw that the coral was only on the outside. Inside, it was a glittering spectacle. I guessed that the coral was to camouflage the palace.

Two mermaids swam up to us. "Welcome back, O Queen," they said.

"This is my daughter, Princess Marina," Mom said, indicating me. "Take her to her quarters, and dress her in a manner more befitting her station."

They did exactly that. My clamshell bra was off in a heartbeat, replaced by something more like what Carrie Fisher wore when she killed Jabba the Hutt. "If I may," I said, "I'd like to keep the clamshell bra. It was a parting gift from dear friends."

"As you wish, Your Highness," they said.

12.content:
My name is Caleb Grayson; or at least it used to be. I recently experienced something that had a profound impact on my life, changing everything about me, and exposing me to a world I never knew existed. You see, I’m now a mermaid living in what surface dwellers have come to know as Atlantis.

*********************


It was finally sunny, after almost a week of near constant rain, and I was going to take full advantage of that. I was sitting in traffic about half a mile from my girlfriend’s apartment, I was on my way to pick her up for a hike in the woods on the edge of town. I was never a fan of hiking until I started dating Ariel; being more inclined to play video games or watch YouTube videos.

Ariel and I met on the first day of classes at the University of West Florida, where we were both working on our Master's in Oceanography. That was almost a year ago, and we’d been dating pretty much the entire time since then. After sitting in traffic for a few minutes more, thanks to people not paying attention to the lights, I eventually pulled into her apartment complex.

I drove around for a few minutes until I saw her walking out of her building. Pulling up next to her, I climbed out of the car and went to kiss her. “You look beautiful today, Ariel.”

“Are you feeling alright, Caleb?” looking at her outfit, consisting of a ratty pair of shorts and shirt, Ariel said, “Because I look like absolute crap.”

Helping Ariel into the car, I said, “I promise I’m fine; can’t a guy compliment his girlfriend?”

Ariel looked at me for a moment before bursting into laughter, “I suppose I can’t fault you for that.” Buckling her seat belt, Ariel said, “Now are we going to do this hike or what?”

Climbing back into the car, I said, “Let’s do it.”

It took all of 15 minutes to get to where we were going; a small dirt-covered parking lot with a trail leading off into the woods. As I got out of the car, I started getting this weird feeling, as if something were calling me into the woods. I must’ve been staring off into space, because suddenly Ariel was standing next to me. “Caleb, you okay?”

Snapping back to reality, I cleared my head and said, “Yeah, I’m just taking it all in.”

We’d been walking for about 10 minutes before I got that feeling once more; this time it was stronger. I tried to resist, but eventually gave in, and started walking off in another direction. Running to catch up with me, Ariel said, “Babe, you’re going off the trail, I don’t think that’s a smart idea.”

“I know, but something is telling me to go this way.” Seeing the weird look on my girlfriend’s face, I said, “I can’t explain it, but I swear something is calling me to it.”

We walked for a few more minutes until we found an opening in the side of a ledge; big enough for us to fit through. Ariel tried to stop me, but I walked inside. After some hesitation, she decided to follow me in.

We walked for about 30 feet before entering a small cavern with a pool of water in the middle. Whatever had been calling me here stopped as I approached the pool.

Standing next to me, Ariel said, “This isn’t something you see every day.”

“Yeah.” Looking at Ariel, I said, “Why don’t you get lunch ready? I-I’m going to take a dip.”

Ariel tried to talk me out of it, saying that I wasn’t wearing a swimsuit and we hadn’t brought towels, but I wasn’t listening.
Unsure of what exactly was compelling me to do so, I took my shirt off and jumped into the water. The first thing I noticed was its warmth; being much warmer than I expected it to be. It was even making my skin tingle in some areas. Looking at me from the shore, Ariel said, “How’s the water?”

Floating on my back, I said, “It feels great, you should try it.”

“Nah, I’m good.” Gesturing for me to return, Ariel said, “Why don’t you come have some lunch.”

As I started swimming back towards the shore, I felt an overwhelming urge to have sex with Ariel. Try as I might, I couldn’t get that urge out of my mind. Climbing out of the water, soaking wet, I approached Ariel and said, “What do you say we have a quick love-making session before lunch?”

“Seriously?” in shock, Ariel looked at me and said, “You want to have sex here, when anyone could just walk in on us?”

“Come on, Ariel.” Moving closer to her, I said, “You said it yourself, we’ve gone off the trail; I doubt anyone will walk in on us.”

It was clear from the look on her face that Ariel was conflicted, until she looked down and saw the tent in my shorts. Giving in to the temptation, Ariel said, “Oh what the hell; there’s always a first time for everything.”

We were both completely naked within seconds, our bodies becoming intertwined for what would become the best sex of our relationship.

Little did we know, however, that it would also be the last time we were ever intimate with each other.

121.content:
Ariel and I spent almost 30 minutes making love to each other; an act which was occasionally interrupted by guttural sounds from Ariel, or statements of disbelief from myself about how amazing the sex was. Eventually, we both got tired, and stopped to catch our breath, lying down on a makeshift blanket of our clothes.

Turning towards Ariel, a smile on my face, I said, “I don’t know about you; but I think that was the best sex we’ve ever had.”

“I’m inclined to agree with you on that; I think I’m going to be sore for a while.” Looking at me, Ariel said, “I don’t know what came over you, but you were so passionate.”

The two of us lay there for a moment until I started feeling a weird sensation coming from my toes; almost as if they were falling asleep, but ten times stronger. Getting myself into a seated position, I looked down, and was shocked by what I was seeing – it was as if my toes were fusing together. “What the hell?” reaching towards my toes, I said, “Ariel, something's wrong with my toes.”

Ariel quickly sat up next to me as my toes continued to fuse together; we both watched as the skin around them started turning a dark green color. “What’s happening to your feet?”

“I-I don’t know!” Starting to freak out, I said, “M-Maybe there was something in the water?”

Ariel quickly jumped to her feet and started drying herself, as I’d gotten some water of her during our lovemaking. It quickly became clear that nothing was happening to her, all while my toes were now completely fused together, and the discoloration was spreading up my feet. Getting on her knees, Ariel reached out and cautiously touched my feet. “Babe, I-I think these are scales.”

“Scales?” confused, looking at her, I said, “As in fish scales?”

“I-I think so, yeah.”

The scales were now past my ankles, as Ariel and I watched in silent horror. As if scales forming on my legs weren’t bad enough, I started feeling a weird sensation on my neck. Bringing my hands up to my neck, I felt what appeared to be flaps on my neck – three of them on each side. I couldn’t get a good look at them, so I got Ariel’s attention. “W-What’s going on with my neck?”

Despite going for a Master's in Oceanography, Ariel had received a Bachelor’s in Marine Science. As she focused on my neck, I felt her lift one of the flaps before recoiling in horror. “I’m not sure what’s going on here, but you’ve got gills.”

I was freaking out at that point; what with the scales now up past my knees and the development of gills on my neck, it was obvious that I was undergoing some bizarre transformation. Things got worse as I noticed my junk receding into a slit no more than three inches in length. God no, not that.

As if watching my manhood disappear wasn’t bad enough, I suddenly felt a strange sensation coming from my rear. Rolling over on my stomach, I said, “I’m almost afraid to ask what’s happening now?”

Looking closely at my rear, Ariel said, “Let’s just say your toes aren’t the only thing fusing together.”

The changes progressed like that for a few minutes, until everything from my belly button down was covered in scales of varying shades of green. Things only got worse as I slowly lost the ability to move my legs; watching helplessly as they began fusing together from my waist down.

Within minutes my legs had fused together into what I could only imagine was a tail – measuring almost five feet in length. Ariel and I watch as fins started growing from the area where my feet had once been – continuing until it was around two feet in length. Once the changes were finished, Ariel and I looked at each other in disbelief.

As impossible as it seemed, I’d somehow turned into a merman.
121.title: I Start Changing

1211.content:
No one said a word for what seemed like an eternity; the only sound we heard came from my gills as they moved with each breath I took. I ran my hands down what had once been my legs; feeling the scales that had, only minutes before, been skin. Once I was able to find my voice again, I turned to Ariel, “Wh-What just happened?”

Ariel stepped back a few feet; probably fearing that she’d be affected in some way. I guess I couldn’t really blame her, I’d probably do the same in her situation. “I-I don’t know, babe.” Gesturing to my tail, she said, “Ca-Can you move that?”

After getting myself in a more comfortable position, I looked down at my tail and tried my hardest to move it. It took some effort, but I eventually managed to lift it a few inches off the ground. “I’m a freaking merman, how is that even possible?”

“We have to get you to a doctor; maybe they can help you.”

I know Ariel was desperate to help me; but I couldn’t help but wish she’d given that idea a little more thought. “Are you being serious right now?” gesturing to my tail, I said, “I’m a merman, Ariel; they’ll probably more inclined to study me then to help me.”

Ariel looked at me with sadness in her eyes; she was having a tough time processing this. She looked as though she was about to say something, when I suddenly grabbed my stomach, feeling an overwhelming feeling of discomfort wash over me.

Running to my side, she said, “Are you alright?”

Clutching my stomach, I looked at her and said, “I-I don’t know; I’ve never felt like this before.” Suddenly realizing my voice sounded different, I said, “What’s happening to my voice?”

Once again, I had to watch Ariel as she took a step back, “Caleb, your voice isn’t the only thing changing.”

Fearful of what I might see, I looked down and saw two fleshy mounds forming on my chest – breasts. Bringing my hands up to them, I said, “Breasts? I’m growing breasts!”

“That’s it, Caleb; we have to get you to a hospital.”

“No!” my voice now unmistakably female, I said, “They’ll never believe this; hell, it’s happening to me, and I can barely believe it.”

Ariel and I watched in silence as the breasts continued to grow, while my waist took on a more feminine appearance. I could only imagine what was happening internally; it wasn’t a stretch to assume I now had female reproductive organs. My vision was suddenly obscured by a fair amount of brown hair. It was only when I reached up to move it that I realized my hands were now feminine as well.

I was perfectly content with staying silent; until I was momentarily blinded by a bright flash. Once my vision cleared, I took and saw Ariel pointing her phone at me. “Seriously?” looking annoyed, I said, “The last thing I want right now is photographic proof of this.”

“Oh, don’t be such a baby.” Handing me the phone, Ariel said, “Besides, I think you look rather nice.”

I begrudgingly took the phone from Ariel and looked at the photo. As I looked at the photo, I saw that there was nothing left of the old me; I was undeniably female in every respect. I had a decent figure, I had shoulder-length brown hair and a rather feminine looking face. A small part of me, one not disturbed by the whole thing, realized that I was now rather attractive – even for someone that was half-fish.

Handing the phone back to Ariel, I said, “So what do we do now?”

“Well, we can’t exactly bring you out in public; even if I was strong enough to carry you the half mile back to the car.” Looking at me in uncertainty, Ariel said, “I think the best bet would be for you to stay here for now.”

I was all ready to agree with her, when suddenly a bright blue light appeared in the pool a short distance from where we were sitting. That was quickly followed by a voice in my head saying –Come home. Come Home. I tried my best to resist, but the urge to follow the voice was too strong. Maneuvering onto my stomach, I started pulling myself towards the water.

“Caleb, what are you doing?”

“I-I don’t know.” Without taking my eyes off the light, I continued pulling myself towards the water. “I just know something is telling me to go towards the light.”

“Caleb, stop; that pool already turned you into a merman and then a mermaid.” Moving to stand in front of me, Ariel said, “We have no idea what will happen to you if you go into that... that thing.”

I’d reached the water at that point; submerging myself and feeling water rushing through my gills with each breath I took. I found that my eyesight was now even better underwater then it had been on land; I could see even the most minute details in the rocks around me. I swam around for a few moments; marveling at how fast and maneuverable I’d become. Popping back to the surface a short distance from shore, I turned to Ariel and said, “Trust me, Ariel; I’ll be okay.”

I ignored Ariel’s pleas as I dove back underwater; swimming towards the bright light before me. Despite my assurances to Ariel, I wasn’t sure what to expect on the other side. I closed my eyes as I swam into the light, not knowing where I would end up.
1211.title: The Changes Aren't Finished Yet

12111.content:
When I came through the portal, I found myself alone in a small room with little in the way of lighting. Thanks to my new enhanced eyesight, however, the lack of lighting wasn’t a problem for me. The portal closed behind me shortly after I came through. As I looked around the room, I saw what looked like light fixtures embedded in the wall, as well as a sealed door in the corner.

With no visible way to open the door, I started to fear that Ariel may have been right – that coming through the portal was a mistake. Swimming up to the door, I started banging on it and screaming at the top of my lungs. “Help! Is someone out there?”

This continued for a while until my voice and energy eventually gave out. Suddenly overcome with fear, I went to a nearby corner and curled up in the fetal position – or the best approximation I could with a nearly 5-foot-long tail and fin. As I lay there, wondering what was going to happen next, I found myself thinking about the events that led me here. I found myself focusing on my decision to jump into the pool; none of this would’ve happened, had I not dove in.

************************


Being inside a sealed off room with no windows, I lost all concept of the passage of time. After coming out of my state of shock, I spent some time exploring my new body. One of the first things I noticed as I reached out to examine my tail was that my fingers were now webbed to a small degree.

I decided to leave a more thorough examination for later, focusing instead on once more trying to find a way out of here. Suddenly, as if answering my prayers, I heard a noise on the other side of the door. Swimming closer to the door, I realized I was hearing voices on the other side, although I couldn’t quite make out what they were saying.

Desperate to get out of the room, I started banging on the door once more, “Please, let me out!”

Within seconds the door opened, revealing half a dozen men floating inside an expansive hallway. The first thing that came to mind as I looked at them, much to my immense shock, was how rugged and handsome some of them looked.

I allowed myself a moment where, to my embarrassment, I found myself growing interested in the men in front of me. That moment quickly faded once they all started entering the room and encircling me. I wasn’t enjoying the looks they were giving me; my mind quickly jumping to the conclusion that they were going to take advantage of me. I wasn’t going to let that happen; so, when one of them approached me, I lashed out and punched him in the nose before swimming for the door.

Unfortunately, my unfamiliarity with my new form proved to be my downfall, as they call up to me before I’d even made it five feet down the hallway. As they started pulling me back into the room, I screamed for help as loud as I could – but no one came.

Once back in the room, one of the men threw me against a wall and said, “How do you get in here?”

“I-I don’t know.” Suddenly feeling more afraid than I’d ever been before, I said, “I-I was in this cave with my girlfriend; I jumped into a pool and it turned me into a mermaid.”

“She’s a surface dweller!” The guy whose nose I punched looked at me, saying, “We must take her to the palace.”

“Very well.” Retrieving what I could only assume were handcuffs from his waist, the leader of the group turned to me. “Don’t try anything stupid, surface dweller; I’m well within my rights to imprison you for assaulting one of my men.”

I nodded in agreement, staying silent, as the man placed the cuffs around my wrist. Before long, I was escorted out of the room by him and his men.
12111.title: The Other Side

121111.content:
I found myself getting a fair number of looks while the men led me through the halls, particularly from the mermaids. It took me a few minutes to realize why they were looking at me; they were wearing what looked like bras, while I was pretty much topless. Becoming self-conscious, I tried my best to cover my chest.

After a few minutes, we eventually came to several vertical shafts built into a wall. I wondered what it was, until I saw a merman swim up through one of them; quickly realizing it must’ve been how they accessed different floors.

The men swam down one of the shafts as they pulled me after them. After swimming out the bottom of the shaft, I said, “Can you guys please tell me where I am?”

The group stopped moving and turned to face me; the leader looking displeased with me. I suppose I couldn’t really blame him, since I had assaulted one of his men. After a tense moment, the leader simply said, “Follow me.”

While the others stayed behind, I cautiously followed the man around a nearby corner – where I found myself in front of a large window. My jaw dropped at the sight before me; an underwater city stretching as far as the eye could see – with buildings of varying heights, mermen and mermaids swimming in the streets below. Turning back to the man, I said, “Where are we?”

“We’re in the city-state of Poseidia.” Moving alongside me by the window, the man said, “It’s located on the southern coast of what surface dwellers consider the lost continent of Atlantis.”

I know I should’ve been more surprised to hear that Atlantis was real; but nothing really surprised me after getting turned into a mermaid. As I turned to look back out the window, I noticed a brightly lit structure on a hill in the distance. Pointing to it, I said, “What’s that?”

His demeanor slowly growing less confrontational, the man said, “That’s the Royal Palace; where Queen Doria lives with her daughter, Princess Marina.” Looking towards me, he said, “That’s where we’re taking you; a surface dweller hasn’t breached our defenses in decades, so the Queen will want to speak with you.”

We stayed by the window for a few moments until the man gestured that it was time to go. Before he swam off, I said to him, “Do you think you could remove these cuffs?” seeing the apprehensive look on the man’s face, I said, “I’m sorry for injuring one of your men; with everything going on, I thought you guys were going to hurt me or something.”

“I suppose I would have reacted the same way.” With a sigh, the man came swam over and removed the cuffs. “Don’t make me regret this, surface dweller.”

For a fleeting moment I considered trying to make a run for it, but realized that would be futile. Eventually, I swam after the man as we joined up with the others. The one I punched looked upset about the fact that I was no longer restrained, but he didn’t say anything.

Once everything was settled, we swam out of the building and towards a nearby cylindrical tube, leading to larger horizontal tube floating above the road. My curiosity was getting the better of me, swimming up to the leader as we entered the larger tube – where I suddenly picked up speed despite barely moving my tail. “What are these?”

“These are mass-transit tubes; similar in function to your subway system.” Looking at me, he said, “With this, we should be at the palace in minutes.”
121111.title: Escorted From the Building

1211111.content:
As we swam along through the tube, I realized that the leader and his men were becoming less hostile towards me. At one point the leader, introducing himself as Arturo, came alongside me. “I can only imagine what you must’ve gone through; transforming into a mermaid as you did.”

I glanced at Arturo for a moment, unsure of how to respond. “It was unlike anything I’d ever experienced before.” Looking at him, feeling hopeful, I said, “What are the chances that all this can be undone?”

“I’m just a simple soldier, so I can’t give you the answer you seek.” Glancing at me, Arturo said, “But I can promise that our healers will do what they can.”

Looking at the city passing by outside, I said, “If it can’t be undone, I suppose there’s worse places for me to live.”

We continued for a few more minutes until someone came up beside me. Turning to my right, I saw the bruised face of the man that I’d punched earlier. I wanted to apologize to him, but the look on his face told me he wasn’t ready to hear it just yet. Ignoring me, he turned to Arturo and said, “Sir; this surface dweller isn’t properly dressed for audience with the Queen.”

I quickly realized that he was referring to my lack of a bra, something I’d seen every other mermaid wearing. “He’s right, Arturo.” Gesturing subtly to my chest, I said, “I’m feeling a tad exposed right now.”

Arturo took one look at me before removing the vest he was wearing. Handing it to me, he said, “This will do for now.”

I looked at the vest briefly before putting it on as I tried to determine what it was made of. It was a material unlike anything I’d ever seen before. After putting it on, and thanking Arturo, I turned to look at the other man. “Hey.” Reaching out to stop him as he turned around, I said, “Listen, I-I’m sorry about earlier; with everything going on, I got worried that you were going to harm me.”

The man was clearly still angry about what happened, but he swallowed his pride and said, “Apology accepted. I am Devere."
1211111.title: Journey to the Palace

12111111.content:
It was much longer before I and my little entourage, if you could call us that, arrived in front of the palace. Let me tell you something; seeing it up close was much different than seeing it from building I’d been in earlier. It looked to be probably 6 stories tall; and encased in something resembling coral.

Arturo and his men led me past a trio of guards stationed at a nearby gate. I’d begun getting the hang of swimming by that point, so I had no problem keeping up with everyone as we swam towards the side of the palace. Turning to look at his men, Arturo said, “You’re all dismissed; I will take it from here.”

I watched as the men saluted Arturo before turning to leave; once they were gone, the two of us swam in through a side door. Once inside, I saw that the interior closely resembled what I imagined most castles would look like – with statues and paintings everywhere. I quickly realized that the coral-like substance was only an exterior thing; the interior of the palace, like the building I’d appeared in, was made of a much smoother material.

As we swam through the halls, my curiosity got the better of me. “Arturo, sir.” Looking at him, I said, “It appears that we’re far below the surface; so, I’m curious as to where this light is coming from.”

“Follow me, I’ll show you.” Swimming towards a nearby wall, Arturo pointed to a clear cylinder attached to the wall. “These are filled with a bioluminescent organism, which gives off light when exposed to an electrical current.”

After that, we continued through the halls until we came to an ornate staircase leading up to the next level. As we swam up the stairs towards a large doorway, we were approached by what I could only assume were guards. “Halt. What is your purpose here?”

“I’m Arturo, captain in the Praetorian Guard.” Gesturing to me, Arturo continued, “This surface dweller appeared through a portal; I’m taking her to see the Queen.”

The guards looked at each other before one of them swam off; but not before asking that we wait here. After a few moments, Arturo turned to me and said, “You’re about to meet our Queen, surface dweller; I trust you’ll be respectful?”

“Yes sir.” Nodding as I nervously ran a hand through my hair, I said, “I promise to be respectful.”

The guard returned not long after and gestured for us to enter. As we swam inside the throne room, I saw that it was surprisingly modest in appearance. Aside from some portraits and statues, the pair of thrones on the far side of the room were the only things to show where we were.

Arturo and I swam up to the throne; I followed his lead as he bowed in reverence to the two mermaids on the thrones. The thrones themselves were quite interesting; resembling stools with section for one to wrap their tails around. I managed to steal a glance at who I assumed were the Queen and Princess; the Queen looked to be in her early to mid-40s, with slight graying of the hair, while the Princess looked like she was in her early teens. The Queen wore a gold crown, while the Princess wore a silver tiara. I found myself focusing on their chest; realizing their bras were more ornate than what I’d seen up to that point. The more I thought about it, the more I realized it must’ve been a status symbol.

The Queen glanced towards the Princess; giving her a look that told her to pay attention. Turning her attention back to me and Arturo, the Queen said, “Forgive me; I’ve been caught up with matters of state.” Getting up from her throne, the Queen swam over to us and said, “What is the reason for your audience, Guard?”

“Your Majesty,” with a quick gesture towards me, Arturo said, “This surface dweller has managed to breach our defenses.”

While the Princess seemed interested in the fact that I was once a surface dweller, the Queen had a more serious response to that revelation. “We haven’t had a breach in decades.” Giving me a stern look, making me feel two inches tall, the Queen continued. “How did she accomplish this?”

“She was discovered in the antechamber for one of the birthing portals.”

I had no clue what Arturo and the Queen were talking about, especially in regard to the aforementioned birthing portal. As the conversation continued, I could tell that things weren’t going in my favor. Therefore, no doubt going against protocol, I decided to speak up, “I apologize, Your Majesty; I meant no harm.” Trying my best to hide my growing sense of fear, I said, “You see; after becoming a mermaid, I was drawn to the... portal.”

Before anyone could stop me, I went ahead and explained everything that happened, leading to my appearance before the Queen. Once I was finished, Queen Doria’s demeanor changed to a more caring one. “I can only imagine how traumatizing such an experience could have been for you.”

“You’re telling me; it ruined the perfect moment between myself and my girlfriend.” Gesturing to my transformed body, I said, “One minute we’re snuggling together; the next I’m turning into a mermaid.”

Giving me a onceover, Queen Doria said, “Am I correct in assuming, based on your facial expressions, that you’ve filled out more than you were before?”

“Much more, Your Highness.” Starting to blush, I said, “You see; before all this, I used to be a guy.”

The Queen and her daughter had markedly different reactions to that revelation; the Queen, while shocked, managed to stay composed. While Princess Marina, to my utter embarrassment, had to cover her mouth to keep from laughing out loud. Even Arturo, who until now had assumed I’d always been female, was shocked. Looking at me, Queen Doria said, “You were a man?”

“Yes ma’am.” Looking at her, I said, “If it’s not too much to ask; I was wondering if you could turn me back into a man before returning me to the surface?”

Queen Doria’s demeanor changed once more; focusing on me, she said, “I’m truly sorry, but we can’t let you return to the surface.”

“What?” flabbergasted, I said, “I have a life on the surface; you can’t just keep me here.”

“Our laws say otherwise, child.” Sighing, Queen Doria said, “If you were to return to the surface with the knowledge of our existence; you’d be putting our entire civilization in grave peril.”

The more I thought about it, the more I realized she was right. “If you won’t let me return to the surface; surely you could at least let me say goodbye to my family?”

“Such a situation hasn’t occurred in nearly 25 years; I’ll have to speak with my advisors about what to do. In the meantime,” placing a sympathetic hand on my shoulder, Queen Doria said, “I’ll make arrangements to have you returned to your rightful gender; and will have accommodations arranged for you.”

“Thank you, Your Majesty.” It wasn’t the news I’d hoped for, but it was better than nothing, “Forgive me, but how long will I be awaiting your decision?”

“It could be days, or it could be weeks, my child.” Looking at me, Queen Doria said, “There are matters at hand more serious than your unfortunate situation.”

With that, Arturo led me from the throne room; once outside, he looked at me and said, “I’m truly sorry; I assumed, under the circumstances, that they would let you return.”

“Thanks, Arturo.” With a wry smile, I said, “At least I get to be a male again.”
12111111.title: Going Before the Queen

121111111.content:
Within minutes of us leaving the Palace, Arturo had brought me to a building a short distance away. There was a sign on the outside of the building, but it was in a language I couldn’t understand. Sensing my confusion, Arturo swam up beside me. “This is one of many healing centers throughout the city.”

As the two of us swam inside the building, I stopped just outside the entrance. “I hope you can forgive my curiosity. But,” in a hushed tone, I said, “Once this procedure is finished; exactly how much of a man will I be?”

Suddenly the shoe was on the other foot, so to speak, as Arturo was confused by my question. “I’m afraid I don’t understand.”

I looked around to ensure the coast was clear, as I was uncertain whether our current topic of conversation was considered taboo. Once satisfied the area was clear, I turned back to Arturo and said, “Once the procedure is finished; will I be able to… well, rise to the occasion?

It appeared that Arturo was finally catching on; looking at me, he said, “Are you unable to reassign one’s gender on the surface?”

“They can; but only to a certain extent.” Pausing for a moment to consider my words carefully, I said, “Trans women can't give birth, and trans men don't have the... well, you catch my drift.”

“Don’t worry, surface-dweller; I can assure you that we’re far beyond that.” With a smile, Arturo said, “Many of our citizens have undergone this procedure; it’ll be as though you were born a merman.”

Satisfied by that answer, Arturo and I continued into the building. As we swam out of one of the vertical shafts, I was surprised to see Princess Marina waiting nearby. Swimming up to her, I said, “Princess Marina, what an unexpected surprise.”

Princess Marina asked Arturo to give us a moment, before leading me around the corner. “I wanted to see you before the procedure; to express my sympathy for the situation you’re in.” Looking at me, she continued, “I, too, was born on the surface.”

I don’t know why, but that news came as a shock to me. “You were?” leaning in, I said, “Does that mean the Queen is, like, your adopted mother or something?”

“Oh, no, she’s actually my mother; I’m the result of her relationship with my human father.” Her face turning sad, Marina said, “I feel sorry for you, because I’m actually free to return to the surface whenever I want.”

“The perks of being royalty, I guess.” Hiding my annoyance, I said, “So how long have you been down here?”

“It’ll be a month next week.”

Marina and I spoke for a few minutes; sharing stories of our lives on the surface. I was in the middle of telling her about Ariel when Arturo came around the corner. “Forgive the intrusion, Princess; but the healers are ready.”

“Very well.” With a smile on her face, Marina looked at me and said, “It was nice meeting you, surface-dweller.”

I realized it was partly my fault for not telling anyone my name; but I’d had enough of people referring to me as ‘surface-dweller.’ Looking at Marina, I said, “Please, call me Caleb.”

“My first crush was on a boy named Caleb; I’ve always liked that name.” With a sincere smile, Marina said, “I truly hope things work out well for you here, Caleb; Poseidia is a wonderful place. And don’t worry; I’ll try to persuade my mother to let you visit your family.”

Upon hearing that, I reached out and embraced Marina, not caring that I was undoubtedly breaking some rule. Apart from Arturo, Marina was the only one who sincerely seemed to be looking out for me.

Breaking the hug, aware of the glare I was receiving from Arturo, I turned to Marina and apologized, “Sorry about that; it’s just been an emotional day.”

“No need to apologize, I probably would’ve done the same thing in your position.”

After Marina swam off, Arturo moved in front of me, his annoyance made clear by the look on his face. “I don’t know what it’s like on the surface, Caleb; but here, we don’t just hug a member of the Royal Family.” Sighing, he said, “Just be glad a member of the Royal Guard wasn’t here; they would’ve thrown you in prison.”

“Sorry Arturo.” With a wince, I said, “It’s just with everything that’s happened, it was nice to meet someone else from the surface.”

“I suppose I can’t fault you for that.” As his glare slowly softened to a frown, Arturo said, “Now come on; the healers are waiting for you.”
121111111.title: A Chance Encounter at the Healing Center

1211111111.content:
I started to feel nervous as Arturo led me into a small nearby room. That feeling grew exponentially once we went inside. Even though there were some notable differences, I could tell that I was inside the underwater equivalent of a procedure room. I could see a hospital bed in the middle of the room, with a device hanging from the ceiling above it.

A mermaid, probably a nurse, came to escort me to the bed. Before turning to leave, Arturo looked at me and said, “I wish you the best of luck, Caleb.”

“Arturo, wait.” Freeing myself from the nurse’s grasp, I swam over to Arturo, “I’ll understand if you don’t want to; but you’re the only person I’ve met so far, aside from the Queen and her daughter, who’s shown any interest in my wellbeing. Would you be willing to stay for moral support?”

It was clear Arturo hadn’t expected me to ask that question; after all, we’d only just met barely an hour earlier. “Of course, Caleb.” With a sincere smile, Arturo said, “I’ll wait outside until the procedure is finished.”

“Thank you.” Resisting the urge to hug him, I said, “There’s one more thing: will this hurt?”

“Any pain you feel will be minimal.” Looking at me, Arturo said, “Trust me when I say you’ll be swimming again in no time.”

A few minutes passed while the nurse and an older mermaid, who I assumed was the doctor, got everything ready. Swimming up to me as I lay on the bed, the doctor said, “Have you been told anything about what you’ll be going through?”

“No, not really.” Getting nervous, I said, “All I’ve really been told is that it’ll make me a man again.”

If the woman was caught off-guard by my comment, her face didn’t show it. “Well then, let me explain how this is going to work.” Gesturing to the device hanging from the ceiling, the woman said, “We’ll start the procedure at your tail, slowly transforming your body as we move along. The entire process should only take a few minutes.”

“That’s really incredible.” looking at the woman, I said, “On the surface, it would take multiple procedures to accomplish the same task.”

As one of the other mermaids moved the device towards me, the older one said, “You needn’t worry about such barbaric medical practices anymore.”

I’ll admit to being a little insulted by that remark: after all, she was implying that surface dwellers were primitive. The more I thought about it, however, the more I realized she was right. With everything that I’d seen so far, I’d say this society was likely centuries more advanced than anything on the surface. As they got the device set up, I said, “I’m ready when you are.”

I gave Arturo, floating outside the room, a reassuring thumbs-up as the doctor started the machine. This resulted in him giving me a peculiar look as he left the room. Once he was outside, I watched as a beam of light came down and started moving up my body. The first few minutes passed by without issue, save for the occasional wince of discomfort.

I passed the time thinking about what my life was going to be like down here; until my thoughts invariably turned to my loved ones on the surface. Will I ever get to see them again? I was pulled from my thoughts when I saw the nurse come over and float beside the bed.

As she sat next to me, I came to a disturbing realization – that I wasn’t attracted to her in the least. “I’m sure you probably get this question all the time. But,” taking a breath as I looked at her, I said, “Will I still be interested in men once this is finished?”

“No; if you’re heterosexual, you become attracted to whatever gender is opposite yours.” Looking at me, she said, “Is that going to pose a problem for you?”

“No, that won’t be a problem for me.” Looking at her, I said, “It’s just with everything I’ve been through today, I wanted to make sure I wasn’t biting off more than I could chew. Part of me was wondering if perhaps being a mermaid wasn't the worst thing in the world.”

As the machine continued its progress up my tail, arriving at the area of my privates, the nurse turned her attention back to me. “Perhaps you wouldn’t mind answering a question for me?”

I suppose it was only fair to think that she’d want to ask me a few questions. Looking at her, thinking it was probably going to be something about life on the surface, I said, “Sure, go ahead.”

“I’m just curious why you referred to a captain in the Praetorian Guard as a sex worker?”

The doctor, working nearby, barely stifled a chortle as I looked at the nurse. “I’m sorry, what?” a little confused, I said, “I just gave him a thumbs-up to let him know I was okay.”

“Oh.” Blushing, the nurse said, “That gesture means something different down here.”

Thinking back, I realized that Arturo had given me a quizzical look. Realizing just how little I knew about this culture, I let out a sigh and said, “Great, more stuff for me to learn.”

“You needn’t worry about that.” With a sincere smile, the nurse said, “Once you’re recovered, you can undergo a procedure that will teach you everything you’ll need to survive here.”

I wanted to acknowledge what the nurse said, but I was suddenly overcome by an intense discomfort as the machine moved further up my body. If it hadn’t been for the restraints, I probably would have injured myself. “I thought you said I wouldn’t feel any major discomfort.”

The doctor came rushing over after the nurse called out for her. “What’s wrong?”

“I feel like my insides are on fire.” Wincing, I looked at the doctor and said, “Is something wrong?”
1211111111.title: The Procedure

12111111111.content:
The doctor checked the readings. "Astounding resistance."

"What's going on?" I asked. "What?"

"Apparently," the doctor said, "whatever is responsible for your transformation is also preventing us from undoing it. No matter how much energy the machine uses to make you male, more comes from within you to restore your feminine biology."

"Are... are you telling me that I'm stuck like this?"

"It appears to be the case. I'm sorry." She shut off the machine, then she and the nurse took me to another room, presumably to recover.

Once they had me lying on the bed, the doctor said, "Please, tell me as much as you can about your metamorphosis. Perhaps we can at least find a clue to understanding this."

So I told her the whole story, from being called to the pool to being called by the portal. "What do you think?"

"My conjecture is that, when you swam in the birthing pool, you absorbed a great deal of the energy left behind by all the merwomen who had given birth in that pool. This energy not only changed you into one of us, it corrected what it sensed as a flaw: your inability to conceive and bear children."

I looked down at myself. "Is... is that possible?"

"I have often heard of infertile merwomen swimming in birthing pools in an effort to conceive. Your experience may explain it. Unfortunately for you, it means that you are a mermaid for the rest of your life. I'm sorry."

I cursed myself. If I had stayed out of that birthing pool, I would be a man, going home right now. Instead, I was a mermaid, and this city would be my new home.
12111111111.title: Yes

121111111111.content:
With some help from the nurse, the doctor was able to bring me down the hall to a private room. I’d barely had a chance to get comfortable before Arturo came in, a sad look on his face. “Please don’t look at me like that, Arturo; I got enough of those looks from the nurse and doctor.”

Swimming up to my bedside, Arturo said, “I’m sorry, Caleb. I truly believed they could make you a man again.”

“Eh, I suppose it’s not all bad.” With a shrug, I said, “At least I’m not dead; I’m just a mermaid for the rest of my life.”

Pulling a chair up to my bed, Arturo said, “You’re remarkably calm about all of this.”

“I’ve always been able to maintain composure during stressful situations.” With a chuckle, I said, “My panicked screams in that cavern notwithstanding.”

Arturo and I chatted for a few minutes, until the topic of my living arrangements came up. Arturo was the only one I knew here, only I suspected he didn’t want a young mermaid living with him. I wasn’t sure how that would look down here, given our age difference. “You needn’t worry about a place to live, Caleb; I’ve spoken with my daughter, Athena, and she’s agreed to let you stay with her.”

“That’s great and all, but does she about my... situation?”

“If you’re referring to your former gender and species, then yes.” Taking my hand in his, Arturo said, “Don’t worry, she’ll help you adjust.”

The strange markings on the wall, like what I’d seen outside, caught my attention. I knew they were letters; but, for the life of me, I couldn’t figure out what they were saying. “How am I going to adjust to living down here when I can’t even read your language?”

As if on cue, the doctor entered the room with a small helmet-like device. Placing it on my head, she said, “This device will teach you everything a mermaid your age should know; from our language and culture to, as the surface dwellers say, more delicate things, like personal hygiene.”

While the doctor tightened the straps, I looked at Arturo and said, “Before you go, Arturo; I could use some help with a new name. Caleb isn’t exactly appropriate for my new gender.”

Arturo was silent for a moment as he considered that question. Eventually, he looked at me and said, “What you choose is entirely up to you; but I have a personal request.” Smiling, Arturo said, “My wife died during the birth of our second child, robbing me of both my wife and my newborn daughter. That little girl would have been Cora. I would be honored if you took her name for your own.”

I started to get emotional, wondering how crying would work underwater. Looking at Arturo, I said, “A-Are you sure?”

“Yes.”

“Okay then.” Looking at Arturo, with a feint smile, I said, “I guess my name’s Cora now.”

With that settled, the doctor activated the device, and I went to sleep.
121111111111.title: Moved to a Private Room

1211111111111.content:
I awoke a short while later to the sounds of a conversation nearby; it didn’t take long before I recognized one of the voices as Arturo’s. Slowly opening my eyes, I saw him floating nearby as he spoke with the doctor, “Was the procedure successful?”

“Yes Captain, the procedure was successful; Caleb...sorry, Cora, now knows everything she’ll need to in order to live in our society.”

Neither of them must’ve known I was awake yet, because they were both startled when I said, “That’s good to hear; because there’s no use living here if I can’t read the language.”

I thought I saw the faintest hint of relief on Arturo’s face as the doctor came over to examine me; it was nice to have someone concerned for me. The doctor placed a small screen in front of me as an image appeared. I recognized some of the letters from earlier, only this time I could understand what they were. Looking at me, the doctor said, “Can you read this sentence, Cora?”

Reminding myself that I’d have to get used to my new name, I smiled and stared at the screen. “May Poseidon’s grace shine upon you.” Turning to look at the doctor, I said, “That’s a greeting, right?”

I saw Arturo smile in the background as the doctor said, “Not quite; the closest surface analogy would be saying ‘amen’ at church.” Looking at me, the doctor said, “Don’t worry dear; give it some time and it will be as though you were born here.”

After asking me a few more questions, which I answered perfectly, the doctor left to give me some time with Arturo. Once we were alone, he swam up to me and said, “I know this might sound strange, seeing how we just met; but I’m proud of you.”

With a smile, I said, “Thanks Arturo, that actually means a lot.”

Giving my hand an affectionate squeeze, Arturo said, “Athena’s going to be here in an hour; I’ll give you some privacy until then.”
1211111111111.title: Waking Up

12111111111111.content:
With nothing to entertain myself with, I passed the next hour thinking about my family on the surface. Despite her assurances, I didn’t have much faith in Princess Marina’s promise to let me see them again. I started getting emotional after a while, so I tried to get my mind off my family, just as Arturo entered the room.

Swimming up to me, he said, “How are you doing, Cora?”

“That’s a tough question to answer, Arturo; my life’s been changed in ways I never thought possible.” Gesturing to my body, I said, “I mean look at me; this morning I was a human guy, now I’m a mermaid.”

Looking at me, with a rather cryptic tone in his voice, Arturo said, “I have some idea what you’re going through, Cora.”

“Unless you’re about to say you were born on the surface, you’ve got no idea what I’m going through.”

Pulling a device from his belt, I watched Arturo do something before turning it towards me. On the screen, I saw what I assumed was a heavily pregnant mermaid floating next to a rather attractive merman. From the way they were looking at each other, I quickly saw they were in love. Pointing towards the mermaid, Arturo said, “That mermaid was me.”

Dumbfounded, I looked at Arturo, “That was you?”

“It all started about 30 years ago now; I had just joined the Praetorian Guard.” Pulling up a chair, Arturo sat down. “I was given an undercover assignment in Olympia, a neighboring kingdom; one that required me to become female.”

I lay in bed completely fixated by what Arturo was telling me. “You see, females aren’t allowed to serve in the Guard; so whoever went on the mission had to become one.” Looking at me, Arturo said, “My assignment was to infiltrate the Olympian Palace as a servant, and determine whether they were going to violate a long-standing peace treaty.”

“That’s all very interesting; but how does that pertain to you getting pregnant?”

“About a year into the assignment, I met this young merman; and it was, as the humans would say, love at first sight. The two of us became inseparable; spending all of our free time together.” Pausing, his face turning serious, Arturo said, “Forming relationships with potential assets was forbidden, but I managed to keep my superiors from finding out for almost 7 months – until I got pregnant.”

Finding myself getting drawn into the story with each passing moment, I said, “What happened next?”

“I had to inform my superiors of what happened; they ordered me to leave, but I refused to do so without my child’s father.” Taking a deep breath as he ran a hand over his mouth, Arturo said, “To make a long story short, we returned to Poseidia. My mate became a citizen, and I gave birth to our child.”

“If you don’t mind my asking, why did you become male again?”

“Joining the Guard was a childhood dream, and I didn’t want to give that up. So, once I was no longer nursing, the two of us underwent the gender-change procedure.”

“What happened to your child and mate?”

“Well you already know what happened to my mate: she died giving birth to your namesake.” Gesturing to the door, Arturo said, “As for my child; well, she’s waiting outside.”

With that, I watched Arturo swim over and open the door, revealing an attractive looking mermaid. I got a good look at her as she entered; everything from her chestnut brown hair to her athletic figure. Swimming into the room, she said, “You must be Cora; I’m Athena, it’s lovely to meet you.”
12111111111111.title: An Hour Later

121111111111111.content:
Coming over to my bedside, Athena said, “How are you adjusting to everything?”

“I think I’m doing a pretty good job, all things considered.” Pointing to Arturo, floating behind his daughter, I said, “I have your dad to thank for a lot of that.”

“I know he tries to act all tough, but, deep down, he’s a big softy.” Leaning closer to whisper in my ear, Athena said, “I think spending 3 years as a mermaid rubbed off on him.”

I giggled as Arturo’s face turned red, “I heard that, young lady.”

“It’s nothing to be ashamed of, Dad.” Looking back at Arturo, Athena said, “You can’t say that experience didn’t have an effect on you.”

Athena and I both giggled as Arturo shrugged his shoulders, “Okay, you’re right; I can’t deny that experience definitely played a role in my life.” Pointing to me, Arturo said, “But enough about me; I brought you here to help Cora.”

“That’s what I plan on doing; but perhaps you could give us some privacy?”

Arturo nodded silently before leaving the room. Once he was gone, I looked at Athena and said, “Is your dad the overprotective type?”

“He can be at times, but he means well.” Pulling up a chair, Athena said, “So Cora, why don’t you tell me a little about yourself?”

****************************


Athena and I spent the better part of an hour getting to know each other; I told her stories about life on the surface, while she told me stories of growing up underwater. The more we talked, the more I got the sense we’d be good friends.

“Once you’re settled, perhaps you wouldn’t mind speaking to my students?” Looking at me, with a smile on her face, Athena said, “It’s not everyday they get an opportunity to speak with someone from the surface.”

“Sure, I’d be happy to; just as soon as I get out of here.”

“Usually merfolk who undergo the procedure are released within hours.” Looking at me, Athena said, “I’m not sure how that applies to someone in your situation, however; I’ve never heard of the procedure not working before.”

“The doctor assigned to my case couldn’t figure it out either; all she said was my body was counteracting everything the machine put out.”

“If you don’t mind my asking, what exactly caused your transformation in the first place?”

“I was taking a hike with my girlfriend; we found this underground cavern with a pool in it. I jumped in for a swim, and within minutes I was transforming into a mermaid.” Readjusting myself in bed, I said, “There’s really no point in dwelling on that now, though; it’s not like it can be undone.”

“You’re being remarkably calm for someone in your position; I certainly wouldn’t be if that happened to me.”

“Believe me, I was far from calm when this first started.” Chuckling, I said, “My girlfriend and I were both freaking out.”

Arturo returned with the doctor at that moment. After giving me a quick once over, she said, “I see no reason to keep you here any longer; you’re free to go.”

Getting out of bed, I thanked the doctor before following Arturo and Athena outside. Once we were outside the Medical Center, Arturo turned to us, “I have to report back about what happened earlier; so, I’ll see you girls later.”

Arturo left shortly after, but not before Athena and I each gave him a goodbye hug. After watching him enter the transit tunnel, I turned to Athena and said, “So what now?”

"That's completely up to you, Cora; we can _____."
121111111111111.title: Getting to know Athena

1211111111111112.content:
I knew it was only a matter of time before the weight of everything came crashing down on me. “If I’m being honest, Athena, I think I’d like to go back to your place and lie down.” With a sigh, I said, “Having your gender and species altered against your will is more exhausting than you might think.”

“I knew I liked you; we both think the same way.” Smiling, Athena said, “I was secretly hoping you’d say that.”

Following Athena as she swam towards the transit tube, I said, “Don’t let my decision keep you from doing anything; you can still go out if you want.”

Looking over her shoulder, Athena said, “No, I don’t think I will. Last night was pretty crazy, even for me.” Turning around to look at me, she said, “I spent most of the evening at a club with my school, dancing and drinking.”

To my surprise, I wasn’t shocked to learn that the night life down here resembled what the surface dwellers had on the surface. Wait, did that just happen? Am I already thinking of them as a separate species? Swimming to catch up with Athena, I said, “Forgive me, my mind is still processing everything; what do you mean by school?”

“Putting it in words you’ll understand, a school is a group of close friends.” Stopping just before the tube, Athena looked at me and said, “Mine consists of myself, my best friend Andromeda, and my cousin Calliope.”

“I hope I’m not being too forward, but what are the chances you’ll let me join your school?”

“I suspect they’re very high, especially after Calliope hears that you’re originally from the surface.” Leaning close to whisper in my ear, Athena said, “Between you and me, she has an interest in surface dwellers who become merfolk.”

I honestly wasn’t sure how to respond to that, so I simply chuckled and said, “Thanks for the heads up.”
1211111111111112.title: Go Home
